author: Special Correspondent
text:
Names of more than 5,000 students have been enrolled in the poll rolls in Namakkal district at the ongoing special campaign.

The district administration to ensure cent per cent enrolment of college students in the poll rolls launched a special campaign under the respective revenue divisional officers.

Of the total 55 colleges identified, campaign had already been completed in 30 colleges.

More than 5,000 students of these colleges have been enrolled as new voters. The rest 25 colleges will be covered shortly, V. Dakshinamoorthy, District Collector, told presspersons here on Wednesday.

He said that Namakkal district registered 82.50 per cent polling during the Lok Sabha elections 2014, compared to the state figures of 78 per cent.

Special initiative will be taken to ensure 90 per cent polling in the district in the forthcoming Assembly elections. Efforts will be taken to create awareness among the people for achieving the same.

The district administration will take initiative to create awareness in the areas where less than 60 per cent polling was recorded in the last Lok Sabha elections, Mr. Dakshinamoorthy said.

Since the poll schedule was announced, a total of 7,430 political advertisement materials were removed.

A total of 37 complaints of poll code violations have been received by the authorities so far, he added.
title: Over 5,000 students enrol as voters in Namakkal district
